Example

Solve the system \(AX=B\) where \[A=\left[\begin{array}{rr}2&3\\ 1&-2\end{array}\right], \hspace{2mm} B = \left[\begin{array}{r}5\\ -1\end{array}\right].\]

Solution

In the previous example, we checked that \(A\) has an inverse and computed it. Therefore, \[X=A^{-1}B=\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{array}{rr}2&3\\ 1&-2\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}{r} 5\\ -1\end{array}\right]=\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{array}{c}7\\ 7\end{array}\right]=\left[\begin{array}{c}1\\ 1\end{array}\right].\]

Hence \(x_1=1,\ x_2=1.\)
